intro: Elatostema cuneiforme var. gracilipes, commonly known as the slender-leafed false shamrock, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Melastomataceae. It is characterized by its small, ovate leaves with a cuneate base and a pubescent underside. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale pink flowers with five petals, typically blooming in the spring. It is native to Southeast Asia and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside of botanical circles.
